metadata.title: CVE-2006-2692 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in aMuleWeb for AMule before 2.1.2allow remote attackers to read arbitrary image, HTML, or PHP files viaunknown vectors, probably related to directory traversal.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2006-2692` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

amule - 2.4.0~git20151120.0023527bc2-1ubuntu1
amule-common - 2.4.0~git20151120.0023527bc2-1ubuntu1
amule-daemon - 2.4.0~git20151120.0023527bc2-1ubuntu1
amule-gnome-support - 2.4.0~git20151120.0023527bc2-1ubuntu1
amule-utils - 2.4.0~git20151120.0023527bc2-1ubuntu1
amule-utils-gui - 2.4.0~git20151120.0023527bc2-1ubuntu1
plasma-widget-amule - 2.4.0~git20151120.0023527bc2-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: amule package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.0~git20151120.0023527bc2-1ubuntu1').
